node.title: Lockdowns favoured professionals and managers, while low-income casuals hit hardest
node.alt: A man in a business shirt and short sits at a laptop.
node.description: With New South Wales, Victoria and the Australian Capital Territory inÂ lockdown during August, new figures show nearly half the nation literally took their work home with them.
node.content:
["More than 40 per cent of employed Australians worked from home in August.", "The Australian Bureau of Statistics surveyed workers over six days in the middle of the month,\u00a0when New South Wales, Victoria and the Australian Capital Territory were all in lockdown.", "While working from home has become just about normal for some occupations since the onset of COVID-19, ABS data showed\u00a0it\u00a0had been growing in popularity before 2020.", "Two years ago, 32 per cent of workers regularly did their job from home, at least some of the time.", "\"The percentage of employed people working from home on a regular basis had been steadily increasing by around a percentage point every two years,\" the head of labour statistics at the ABS,\u00a0Bjorn Jarvis, said.", "But that skyrocketed when Delta came to Australia.", "\"Our latest data \u2014\u00a0for August 2021\u00a0as the Delta period impacts were deepening \u2014\u00a0are showing an 8.4 percentage point jump to 40.6 per cent,\" Mr Jarvis observed.", "Not surprisingly, professional workers and managers were working from\u00a0home the most, at 65 per cent, compared to other occupations where just a quarter\u00a0of employees worked remotely.", "
Other working conditions haven't changed much
", "Workplaces quickly adapted to working from home, but the data showed\u00a0other changes \u2014\u00a0such as\u00a0the hours people work \u2014\u00a0have not changed very much.", "\"Interestingly, while the pandemic has seen a large shift in people working from home, there haven't been similarly large changes in other working arrangements, such as working Monday to Friday only,\"\u00a0Mr Jarvis noted.", "The chart below shows incremental changes to conditions, including working flexible hours and days worked, between August 15 and 21.", "", "
There was a jump in the number of people working from home in mid August, while other data, like days worked, remained fairly consistent.(Source: ABS)
", "\"Working arrangements other than working from home have generally followed pre-pandemic trends,\" Mr\u00a0Jarvis said.", "
Lockdowns hit lower-paid workers harder
", "The lockdowns significantly affected\u00a0employees earning smaller incomes.", "", "
August lockdowns across Australia's south-east saw work-from-home rates jump above 40 per cent nationally.(Supplied: Unsplash)
", "There were\u00a0half a million fewer low paid workers in August 2021, compared to the same period before the pandemic in 2019.\u00a0", "\"In August, 2021, the number of employed people who were earning less than $1,000 per week fell \u2026\u00a0from 4.5 million in August 2019 to just over 4 million in 2021,\" Mr\u00a0Jarvis observed.", "In contrast, the number of people earning $1,000 or more per week increased by 8 per cent between August 2019 and 2021.", "But that is still below the pre-pandemic\u00a0growth rate,\u00a0which was 14 per cent between August 2017 and 2019.", "", "
Casual workers have been hard hit by the pandemic due to their over-representation in hospitality and other service sectors adversely affected by lockdowns.(ABC News: Emilia Terzon)
", "Casual workers also bore the brunt, making up a greater share of the hospitality and other service industries shut or severely restricted\u00a0during lockdown.", "In the survey period, 22.5 per cent (or 2.4 million) of all workers were casual staff.", "Just four months prior, in May 2021, 23.6 per cent of workers were casual\u00a0and, before the pandemic\u00a0in February 2020, almost a quarter (24.1 per cent) of the workforce was\u00a0in casual roles."]
